faqsData.title: Frequently asked questions
faqsData.description: Find quick answers to common queries.

1.title: How does an eSIM work?
1.body: An eSIM works like a digital version of a physical SIM card. Instead of inserting anything, you download a mobile plan directly onto your phone. Once activated, your device connects to local networks just like a regular SIM, but without the hassle of swapping cards when you travel.

2.title: Can I use Smart eSIM in any country I travel to?
2.body: Yes! Smart eSIM covers 200+ destinations. You can land anywhere in Europe, Asia, the Middle East, or the Americas and stay connected instantly. Just pick a plan for your destination, install it, and you‚Äôre online as soon as you turn on mobile data.

3.title: How do I install or activate Smart eSIM?
3.body: Activation is quick. After you buy a plan, you‚Äôll receive a QR code or an in-app install link. Open your phone‚Äôs Mobile/Cellular settings, tap ‚ÄúAdd eSIM‚Äù, scan the code, and switch it on. Your data starts working within minutes without any document verification or waiting in lines.

4.title: Which phones support eSIM?
4.body: Most modern smartphones support eSIM, including recent iPhones (XS and newer), Samsung Galaxy models, Google Pixel devices, and several newer Android phones. If you‚Äôre unsure, check our Esim Compatible devices from the More menu. It only takes a few seconds to confirm.

5.title: Is using an eSIM safe and secure?
5.body: Yes. eSIM technology uses encrypted profiles that protect your connection from SIM-swap attempts and unauthorized access. Your data stays safe as long as your phone is secured with a screen lock and two-factor authentication for sensitive apps.

6.title: Can I use Smart eSIM while switching between multiple countries on the same trip?
6.body: Yes. If your plan supports multi-country coverage, your Smart eSIM will automatically connect to local partner networks as you cross borders. There‚Äôs no need to reinstall anything. Your phone simply picks up the next available network.

7.title: Does my eSIM expire if I don‚Äôt use it right away?
7.body: Most Smart eSIM plans include an activation window, usually between 30 and 90 days. You can buy now, install when you're ready, and your validity only starts when the eSIM connects to the network for the first time. It‚Äôs perfect for planning.

faqsData.description: Find quick answers to common queries.

1.title: Can I buy a Smart eSIM before my trip?
1.body: Yes. You can purchase your Smart eSIM anytime before you travel. The plan only starts once the eSIM connects to a local network at your destination. Buying early is a smart way to avoid airport stress.

2.title: Can I buy and activate a Smart eSIM while I‚Äôm already abroad?
2.body: Yes, you can. As long as you have Wi-Fi, you can purchase a plan, scan the QR code, and activate your eSIM within minutes. It‚Äôs perfect for last-minute travel or when your roaming becomes too expensive.

3.title: Where is the best place to buy a Smart eSIM for international travel?
3.body: You can buy it directly from the Smart eSIM website or download the app. The app is available for both iOS and Android stores. Choose your country or region, select a data plan, and install it instantly.

4.title: Can I buy a Smart eSIM for someone else?
4.body: Yes. After you complete the purchase, you can share the activation QR code with a friend or family member. They simply scan it on their device and connect. It‚Äôs great for gifting or group travel.

5.title: How do I check if my phone supports eSIM?
5.body: Most recent iPhones, Samsung, Google Pixel, and other flagship Android models support eSIM. We provide a complete compatibility list on our website, so you can confirm your device before buying.

6.title: Is it cheaper to buy a Smart eSIM before or after I travel?
6.body: Buying before you leave is usually more affordable. It helps you avoid airport SIM booths, last-minute roaming charges, and inflated tourist prices. Also, you land with internet ready to go.

7.title: Will my Smart eSIM work across multiple countries?
7.body: If you choose a regional or Global eSIM plan, yes. Your Smart eSIM will automatically connect to the strongest local network as you travel, with no reinstalling or switching required.

faqsData.title: Frequently asked questions
faqsData.description: Find quick answers to common queries.

1.title: What is a Regional eSIM?
1.body: A Regional eSIM is one eSIM that covers multiple countries in a single data plan and one eSIM profile. For example, you can visit all the countries in the European region with a single eSIM profile.

2.title: Can you use eSIM in different countries?
2.body: Yes, you can use one eSIM in different countries, but it depends on which eSIM plan you are using. Local eSIMs work in one country, Regional eSIMs cover up to 34 countries, and Global eSIMs can be used in around 64 countries.

3.title: In which regions does Smart eSIM offer services?
3.body: Smart eSIM offers services in various regions, including Africa, Asia, Europe, North America, South America, and Oceania.

4.title: Which is the best Regional eSIM Europe plan?
4.body: Smart eSIM offers different regional eSIM plans for Europe, with validity ranging from 7 to 30 days and data from 1GB to 20GB per month. The best plan is 10GB for a 30-day period, costing only $13.03.

5.title: Which is the best Asia Regional eSIM plan?
5.body: Smart eSIM offers various Asia Regional eSIM plans, with validity ranging from 7 to 30 days and data from 1GB to 20GB per month. The best plan is 10GB for a 30-day period, priced at $34.70.

6.title: Are these Regional eSIMs prepaid or postpaid?
6.body: Regional eSIMs from Smart eSIM are prepaid. This means you pay upfront for the data you want to use.

faqsData.title: Frequently asked questions

1.title: Which eSIM data plan should I choose for {region}?
1.body: Choose a plan based on your data needs and length of stay. eSIMCard offers various local, regional, and global plans from a duration of 1 to 30 days.

2.title: How to buy eSIM in {region}?
2.body: You can purchase an eSIM online from eSIMCard's website or app available for iOS and Android. Just select your desired plan and follow the checkout process.

3.title: How to activate eSIM for {region}?
3.body: After purchasing, you can activate your eSIM through eSIMCard's app, available on both Android and iOS. The process involves scanning the eSIM QR code provided after purchase.

4.title: How to use eSIM in {region}?
4.body: Ensure your device is eSIM-supported. Install the eSIM using the provided QR code and choose it as your active cellular plan in your device settings.

5.title: When does my data plan start?
5.body: Once you have reached your destination and consumed the first byte of data, your eSIM data plan is considered active. From this point, the data usage is counted towards your plan's allowance.

6.title: Can I top-up or extend the data on my eSIM?
6.body: Yes, you can top-up or extend your data plan through the eSIMCard app, where you can manage your plans and purchase additional data as needed.

7.title: Can I get a refund from eSIMCard?
7.body: At eSIMCard, refunds are available for coverage issues, technical issues, or incorrect charges. Refund requests must be submitted within 12 days, and if approved, the amount will be returned within 1 to 3 business days.

8.title: What is the fair usage policy for eSIM unlimited data plans?
8.body: According to the Fair Usage Policy (FUP), in rare scenarios, internet speed may be reduced after using 1 GB of data daily. Normal speeds resume the next day to ensure consistent service for all users.

9.title: Can I use my SIM card and eSIMCard eSIM at the same time?
9.body: Yes, if your device supports dual SIM functionality, you can use both a physical SIM card and an eSIM simultaneously.

10.title: Can I tether or use a personal hotspot?
10.body: Yes, you can use tethering and set up a personal hotspot with your eSIM from eSIMCard. This allows you to share your internet connection with other devices while traveling.

1.title: Which is the best eSIM for International travel?
1.body: The best eSIM for international travel depends on your needs‚Äîdestination, data usage, and budget. Look for providers with wide coverage and flexible, affordable plans. We recommend Smart eSIM for top international options.

2.title: Where can I buy International eSIM plans?
2.body: You can buy international eSIM plans online through eSIM providers' websites or apps. With Smart eSIM, you can purchase and download eSIM profiles directly to your device‚Äîquick and hassle-free.

3.title: How much does an international eSIM cost?
3.body: International eSIM costs vary by data, coverage, and duration. Prices range from just a few dollars for short-term use to higher for broader coverage. Smart eSIM plans start at just $2.40/month.

4.title: Does eSIM work on international roaming?
4.body: Yes! eSIMs support international roaming by connecting to local networks abroad. This allows you to use data and make calls without the high fees of traditional roaming.

5.title: Which eSIM is best for worldwide roaming?
5.body: The best eSIM for worldwide roaming offers wide global coverage, letting you travel across multiple countries without switching SIMs. Look for global eSIM plans like those from Smart eSIM.

6.title: How does a global eSIM work?
6.body: A global eSIM lets you download a digital SIM profile and connects to local networks across supported countries. No need for a physical SIM‚Äîjust activate and you're connected.

7.title: What is the difference between global eSIM and local eSIM?
7.body: Global eSIMs offer coverage in multiple countries, perfect for multi-destination trips. Local eSIMs work in one specific country or region, ideal for long stays and often more cost-effective.

faqsData.title: Frequently asked questions
faqsData.description: Find quick answers to common queries.

1.title: What is an eSIM, and how does Smart eSIM work?
1.body: An eSIM is a digital SIM built into your phone, letting you connect to mobile networks without swapping a physical card. Smart eSIM makes this process simple: choose your destination, buy a plan, scan the QR code, and your device activates instantly. Fast, secure travel data the moment you land.

2.title: What are the downsides of eSIM, and how does Smart eSIM address them?
2.body: Some travelers worry about compatibility or losing service while switching networks. Smart eSIM solves this by offering clear device-compatibility guidance, step-by-step activation, and access to top-tier networks in 200+ countries. We also provide quick support if you ever need help. The goal is simple: make eSIM use seamless, even for first-timers.

3.title: Is an eSIM better than a physical SIM for international travel?
3.body: For most travelers, yes. A Smart eSIM gives you instant activation, no roaming fees, and the freedom to connect anywhere. You keep your primary physical SIM for calls and use Smart eSIM for reliable high-speed data abroad. It‚Äôs faster, safer, and far more convenient than traditional SIM cards.

4.title: Does Smart eSIM give me a local or international phone number?
4.body: Smart eSIM travel plans are designed for data connectivity, so most plans do not include a local phone number. You can still use WhatsApp, FaceTime, Messenger, and VoIP apps normally. If you need calling features, we also offer plans that include voice options depending on the country or region.

5.title: Is getting a Smart eSIM worth it for travel?
5.body: Absolutely. A Smart eSIM helps you avoid roaming charges, skip airport SIM queues, and stay online right when you land. It‚Äôs especially useful for frequent travelers, digital nomads, students, and families who need stable and affordable internet in multiple countries. One purchase, one scan, and your trip stays connected from start to finish.

6.title: What are the risks of using an eSIM, and is Smart eSIM safe?
6.body: Smart eSIM is built with secure, encrypted connectivity that protects your data from SIM-swap attacks and unauthorized access. Unlike physical SIMs, an eSIM can‚Äôt be removed or cloned. Your information stays protected, and you stay connected to trusted network partners worldwide. For travelers, it‚Äôs one of the safest ways to stay online.

faqsData.title: Frequently asked questions
faqsData.description: Find quick answers to common queries.

1.title: How do I contact Smart eSIM customer support?
1.body: You can reach our team through live chat or email anytime. Live chat gives the fastest reply, and email inquiries are answered within one business day.

2.title: How do I fix eSIM network or connection issues?
2.body: Most issues are resolved by enabling data roaming, restarting the phone, or selecting a different available network. If the problem continues, message our support team, and we‚Äôll troubleshoot it with you.

3.title: How do I activate my Smart eSIM?
3.body: After purchasing your plan, scan the QR code or use the in-app setup option. Go to your device settings ‚Üí Add eSIM ‚Üí Follow the prompts. Activation typically takes under two minutes.

4.title: Why isn‚Äôt my eSIM activating on my iPhone?
4.body: Make sure your phone is carrier unlocked, connected to Wi-Fi, and supports eSIM. If the QR code doesn‚Äôt install, restart your device and try again. Our team can help you troubleshoot if it still won‚Äôt activate.

5.title: Can Smart eSIM give me a phone number?
5.body: Some Smart eSIM plans are data-only, while others include a phone number or virtual number. Check your plan details before purchase or ask our team to confirm what‚Äôs included.

6.title: How do I stop my eSIM from renewing automatically?
6.body: You can cancel auto-renewal from your Smart eSIM account or contact our support team to assist you. Once turned off, your plan won‚Äôt renew again.

hero.title: Frequently Asked Questions
hero.description: Find quick answers to common queries

faqsData.title: These are some of the most frequently asked questions!
faqsData.description: Find quick answers to common queries.

1.title: What is an eSIM, and how does it work?
1.body: An eSIM is a built-in digital SIM that lets you activate mobile service without a physical card. It downloads a mobile plan directly to your phone and connects you to local networks instantly. For travelers, it removes the need to swap SIMs at airports or shops.

2.title: What are the downsides of eSIM?
2.body: The main downside of an eSIM is the need for a compatible device and a stable installation process. You cannot physically remove it like a normal SIM, and switching phones needs a transfer step. For most travelers, these limits are minor compared to the flexibility it offers.

3.title: Do eSIMs use your phone number?
3.body: Yes, an eSIM can use your phone number if your carrier supports number transfer. Travel eSIMs usually provide data only, so your WhatsApp, iMessage, and social apps still use your existing number. You can keep your primary SIM active for calls while using eSIM data.

4.title: Is getting an eSIM a good idea?
4.body: Yes, an eSIM is a smart choice because it offers fast setup, better security, and easy travel use. It helps you avoid roaming fees, airport SIM lines, and the risk of losing physical cards. Most travelers find eSIMs more convenient and cost-effective than traditional SIMs.

5.title: How do I contact an eSIM provider?
5.body: You can contact an eSIM provider through their app, help center, or 24/7 chat support. Most brands also offer email support and step-by-step troubleshooting inside the dashboard. Support is usually faster than physical carriers because everything is handled online.

6.title: How do I activate my eSIM?
6.body: You activate an eSIM by scanning a QR code or tapping an in-app install button. Your phone adds the eSIM profile inside Mobile/Cellular Settings and connects in minutes. It works the same whether you activate before travel or at your destination.

7.title: Does an eSIM give you a phone number?
7.body: A standard eSIM from your carrier can carry your phone number, just like a physical SIM. Travel eSIMs usually come as data-only, so they do not assign a new number for calls. All calling apps like WhatsApp, FaceTime, Messenger, still use your regular number.

8.title: Is an eSIM worth it?
8.body: Yes, an eSIM is worth it if you want cheaper data, safer connectivity, and no roaming surprises. You install it once, switch countries smoothly, and avoid handling tiny SIM trays. Frequent travelers save the most because plans are flexible and low-cost.

9.title: What are the risks of eSIM?
9.body: The main risk is installation errors if the QR code is scanned incorrectly or deleted early. Another is losing access if your phone is damaged, since the eSIM cannot be removed physically. Using a trusted provider reduces almost all eSIM-related issues.

10.title: Does eSIM drain battery?
10.body: No, an eSIM does not drain battery more than a physical SIM. Battery usage depends on network strength, background apps, and location services, not the eSIM itself. Most travelers see the same or better battery life when using eSIM data.

11.title: Do Smart eSIM cards allow you to text?
11.body: Yes, you can text through apps like WhatsApp, iMessage, and Telegram using an eSIM data plan. But Smart eSIM is still looking to get you the offer. Only carrier-issued eSIMs support regular SMS texting with your phone number. For travel, messaging apps replace SMS for most people.

12.title: Can I convert my SIM to eSIM?
12.body: Yes, many carriers let you convert a physical SIM to an eSIM through their app or account portal. You receive a QR code or activation link that moves your number to the eSIM profile. The process usually takes less than two minutes.

13.title: Is it better to have an eSIM or a physical SIM?
13.body: An eSIM is better for travel, flexibility, security, and switching networks without swapping cards. A physical SIM is useful only if your device is older or your carrier lacks eSIM support. Most new phones work best with eSIM as the main line.

14.title: Can eSIM cause problems?
14.body: eSIM issues are rare and usually come from incorrect installation or unsupported devices. Most problems are solved by reinstalling the profile or updating your phone settings. Trusted providers like Smart eSIM offer instant re-issues if something goes wrong.

15.title: Do eSIMs give you a local number?
15.body: Only carrier plans offer a local phone number for calls and SMS. Travel eSIMs provide data only, so you use your existing number through apps. If you need a real local number, you must buy a local voice plan.

16.title: Can I get a US number with eSIM?
16.body: Yes, if you purchase a US carrier eSIM or a virtual number service. Travel eSIMs for the US offer data but do not assign a US mobile number. VoIP apps like Google Voice can provide a US number if needed. Smart eSIM is data-only for now, but soon it will offer virtual numbers too.

17.title: Why shouldn‚Äôt I use an eSIM?
17.body: You may avoid eSIM only if your device is incompatible or if you need physical SIM swapping. Some users who frequently switch phones prefer physical cards. For most travelers, eSIM is the better, easier option.

18.title: How do I fix eSIM network issues?
18.body: You can fix eSIM issues by toggling Airplane Mode, restarting your phone, or resetting network settings. Sometimes selecting the correct network manually solves roaming or signal problems. The Smart eSIM app also includes a built-in troubleshooting guide.

19.title: Does deleting an eSIM cancel your service?
19.body: Deleting an eSIM removes the profile from your phone. Some eSIM providers follow the one-time removal policy. It means if you delete the eSIM profile, then you need to buy a new one to reuse. If you delete your Smart eSIM profile, you will need to buy it again because the service will be cancelled.

hero.heading: eSIM Compatible Phones
hero.description: eSIM compatible devices are smartphones, tablets, smartwatches, and other gadgets that support embedded SIM (eSIM) technology. Unlike traditional SIM cards, eSIMs are built into the device and can be activated digitally without needing a physical card. This allows for easier switching between carriers, better security, and support for multiple profiles on one device. Popular eSIM-compatible devices include newer models from Apple, Samsung, Google, and some laptops and wearables.
hero.compatibleDevicesDescription: Here you can write your device name, Or check our <FooterLink>Supported Devices Page</FooterLink>
hero.wantToBuy: Do you want to buy eSIM for

iPhones.heading: Here's the list of eSIM Compatible Iphones
iPhones.description: iPhone XR and above Iphones are eSIM embedded.The iPhone XR was the first to step into the eSIM world, followed by the XS and XS Max. Then the iPhone 11 series and SE 2 said hello to eSIM in 2020.

iPads.heading: iPads with eSIM (Cellular Models)
iPads.description: You might wonder, "Is my iPad model eSIM compatible?" Good news: many recent models are. From the iPad Pro to the iPad Air, and even the iPad mini, there's likely an eSIMready iPad that fits your hand and your lifestyle.

Samsung.heading: Samsung phones that support eSIM
Samsung.description: Isn't it nice when things are built in and ready to go? That's the beauty of eSIM technology in these Samsung phones. With eSIM on Samsung phones, you're ready to connect to your network with just a few taps. Now the question pops up, which Samsung phone has esim technology?
Samsung.descriptionTwo: So, Here is the Complete list of Samsung phones with esim technology

GooglePixel.heading: Google Pixel phones
GooglePixel.description: If you've got a Google Pixel in your pocket, you might already be set for the eSIM revolution. Isn't it nice when things are just simple? Now, here's a question to address: Is my Google pixel phone esim compatible?
GooglePixel.descriptionTwo: Pixel 3a from countries in South East Asia Doesn‚Äôt support eSIM.

Huawei.heading: Huawei phones that support eSIM
Huawei.description: Does Huawei Phone support eSIM? Not all Huawei models supports eSIM, but some Huawei phones are eSIM-compatible. Check out the Huawei eSIM compatible phones list to see if your device supports eSIM.

Oppo.heading: Oppo mobiles that support eSIM
Oppo.description: Does Oppo Phone support eSIM? Check out this Oppo eSIM Compatible Phone List to see which device keeps you connected effortlessly?

Sony.heading: Sony phones with eSIM
Sony.description: Struggling to find a Sony phone with eSIM support? Not all models are eSIM competible. Check out the Sony eSIM compatible phones list to see if your device supports eSIM.

Xiaomi.heading: Xiaomi phones with eSIM
Xiaomi.description: Explore the Xiaomi eSIM phone list to see which Xiaomi phones support eSIM and enjoy seamless digital connectivity without the need for a physical SIM.

Motorola.heading: Motorola phones with eSIM
Motorola.description: Check the Motorola eSIM compatible phone list to see which Motorola phones support eSIM and stay connected wherever your journey takes you.

Honor.heading: Honor phones with eSIM
Honor.description: Looking for eSIM-compatible phones rather than expensive flagship models? Honor has launched some eSIM-compatible models that are affordable to everyone. Check out the list of Honor eSIM-compatible phones list.

OtherAndroid.heading: Other Android mobiles that support eSIM
OtherAndroid.description: Which other Android phones support eSIM? From Surface Pro tablets to Sharp Aquos, from Gemini PDA to Rakuten and Honor Magic, more devices offer Other Android eSIM-compatible phones for seamless connectivity.

supportedSection.heading: Number of eSIMs Supported by Smartphones and Wearables
supportedSection.description: The number of eSIMs supported by smartphones varies depending on the manufacturer and the specific model of the device. Most modern smartphones, particularly flagship models from major brands like Apple, Samsung, and Google, typically support at least one eSIM. However, some models, especially newer ones, may support more eSIMs. Which enables users to have separate cellular plans or numbers on the same device.
supportedSection.descriptionTwo: The exact number of eSIMs supported can usually be found in the device's specifications. But for your convenience, We have listed theNumber of eSIMs supported by each device.

faqsData.title: Frequently asked questions
faqsData.description: Find quick answers to common queries.

1.title: Can I make my device eSIM compatible?
1.body: Unfortunately, you can't just wave a magic wand to make your phone eSIM compatible. It‚Äôs a bit like asking if you can turn a toaster into a coffee maker ‚Äì they‚Äôre just built differently. eSIM compatibility is determined by your device‚Äôs hardware and software, so if it wasn‚Äôt designed with an eSIM in mind, it‚Äôs a no go.

2.title: How do I know if my phone is eSIM compatible?
2.body: Checking if your phone is eSIM compatible? Just take a peek at the settings or specifications of your device. For iPhones, go to Settings ‚Üí General ‚Üí About and look for eSIM details. Or simply search online with your phone model to check if it supports eSIM ‚Äî quick and easy!

3.title: Does iPhone 12 support eSIM?
3.body: Yes, the iPhone 12 series supports both physical nanoSIMs and eSIMs. So, you can use one for business and another for personal calls, or for traveling abroad.

4.title: Is eSIM better than physical SIM?
4.body: Better is a strong word, let's say eSIMs are more sleek, without the need for a physical card, making it faster to switch carriers or plans. Plus, they're a traveler‚Äôs best friend, letting you hop onto local data plans without swapping SIM cards. But remember, just like physical SIMs, eSIMs need your device‚Äôs support to work.

data.title: 1. Validity of General Terms and Conditions

content.text: These Terms and Conditions are applicable to all services provided by our company in relation to the reselling of prepaid eSIMs. These terms are binding and enforceable upon the use of our services.
We may accept variations to these terms only if explicitly agreed upon in writing.
Our services include providing and managing eSIMs (electronic SIM cards) for mobile devices, enabling users to access cellular networks without needing a physical SIM card.
Unlimited bundles offer 1GB of unthrottled 5G data every 24 hours from the first use. After the 1GB is used, unlimited data is available at reduced speeds for the rest of the 24 hours.

We offer prepaid eSIMs for purchase, which can be used in various regions and countries. These eSIMs are designed to provide customers with a convenient and flexible way to access mobile data services.

To use our services, customers must register and provide necessary personal information such as name, address, and email. This registration process is essential for activating and managing the eSIM services.
We strive to provide high-quality service to our customers. However, we do not guarantee uninterrupted or error-free service.
Customers are expected to use our services responsibly. Abusive, illegal, or fraudulent actions are prohibited and may result in suspension of services.
Customers are responsible for ensuring their devices are compatible with eSIM technology. Compatibility varies based on carrier and country of origin.
Personal Information: Customers must provide accurate personal details including name, billing address, and email.
Account Creation: Customers create an account to manage purchases and eSIM usage.
Acceptance of Terms: Customers must accept the Terms and Conditions during registration.
Device Compatibility Check: Customers are responsible for verifying device compatibility before purchase.
Selection of eSIM: Customers can choose from multiple eSIM plans.
Payment Process: Payments are accepted via Credit/Debit Card, Google Pay, Apple Pay, and Alipay in USD.
eSIM Delivery: eSIMs are delivered electronically via email and user account.
Activation: Activation requires scanning a QR code and following provided instructions.
Support and Assistance: Our support team assists with activation issues.
Payments can be made using Credit/Debit Cards, PayPal, Google Pay, Apple Pay, and Alipay.
All transactions are processed in US Dollars (USD) and secured via payment providers such as Stripe.
eSIMs are non-refundable. Refunds are not provided for incompatible or locked devices.
Unlimited bundles may experience reduced speeds after maximum data usage.
Monthly subscriptions must be renewed to retain the number.
Virtual numbers do not support WhatsApp OTP codes and are non-refundable.
These terms are governed by the laws of the jurisdiction where the service provider is registered.
Services are provided ‚Äúas is‚Äù without warranties of any kind. The provider is not liable for indirect or consequential damages.
For assistance, contact our support team via email.
Email Support: support@smartesim.co
WhatsApp Support: +1(360)581-4579
All intellectual property related to the service belongs to the service provider.
Personal data is handled according to our Privacy Policy.
Users may not assign their rights without prior written consent.
Services are activated immediately or at a scheduled time after purchase.
Service access is available via the user account under ‚ÄúMy eSIMs‚Äù.
We reserve the right to modify these terms at any time.
If any provision is found invalid, the remaining provisions remain in effect.
Failure to enforce any right does not constitute a waiver.

metaData.title: Smart eSIM Refund Policy: Clear Guidelines for Refunds & Eligibility
metaData.description: Smart eSIM refund policy, covering eligibility, technical issues, and device compatibility for a seamless eSIM experience. Request refunds with ease.
metaData.keywords: eSIM, buy eSIM, regional eSIM, local eSIM, buy regional eSIM, buy local eSIM, purchase local eSIM, purchase regional eSIM, data eSIM, e-SIM, eSIM plan, eSIM store, eSIM marketplace, traveler, data plan, buy e-SIM, cheap data, connectivity

refundPolicy.title: Refund Policy
refundPolicy.description: At eSIM, we‚Äôre committed to ensuring that our customers get a seamless and enjoyable experience. Our refund policy is designed to offer clarity in the rare instances where you may need to request a refund. Below, you‚Äôll find detailed information on our refund procedures and conditions.

content.text: Coverage Issues: If the eSIM cannot be installed due to coverage problems, you may request a refund or change.
Technical Issues: In cases where technical problems originate from eSIM and cannot be resolved promptly, refunds are possible only if no data has been consumed.
Data Package Validity: No refunds are offered once the eSIM is installed and used.
Accidental Purchases: No refunds are offered once the eSIM is installed and used.
Incorrect Charges: Disputes on charges must be notified within 12 days of receipt, containing details of why the amount is incorrect.
Fraudulent Activities: eSIM reserves the right to refuse refunds in cases of suspected abuse, term violation, or fraudulent activities.
Phone Compatibility: It‚Äôs crucial to ensure your phone is eSIM compatible before purchase. No refunds are issued for incompatibility issues.
One-time Purchase: eSIM is a one-time purchase and non-refundable.
Virtual Numbers: Virtual Numbers will not work on WhatsApp and other social media services, and the customer is not entitled to a refund if OTP codes are not received.
Time Frame: Refund requests must be made within 30 days of purchase.
Cooperation: Prompt and timely cooperation in troubleshooting is required for refund consideration.
Notification: Email support@smartesim.co with your refund request, providing relevant details and reasons.
Unauthorized Purchases: Subject to investigation and approval.
Modification: No modifications or customizations are allowed post-purchase.
Ultimate Mobile Services: Service suspension may occur without notice and is not subject to refunds.
Note: eSIM reserves the right to cancel purchases if fraud or spam usage is suspected.
Fair Usage Policy: Applies to all bundles and plans.
Liability: eSIM is not liable for service unavailability or network-related issues.
Warranty: No guarantees are provided for constant or uninterrupted network availability.
For any queries or assistance, please contact our support team at
support@smartesim.co
We‚Äôre here to help you for a smooth and hassle-free experience.

metaData.title: Smart eSIM Privacy Policy: Protecting Your Personal Data & Security
metaData.description: Learn how Smart eSIM collects, uses, and secures your data. Explore privacy rights, cookie usage, and security measures to ensure a safe online experience.
metaData.keywords: eSIM, buy eSIM, regional eSIM, local eSIM, buy regional eSIM, buy local eSIM, purchase local eSIM, purchase regional eSIM, data eSIM, e-SIM, eSIM plan, eSIM store, eSIM marketplace, traveler, data plan, buy e-SIM, cheap data, connectivity

content.text: Our website address is:
https://smartesim.co/
When visitors leave comments on the site, we collect the data shown in the comments form, as well as the visitor‚Äôs IP address and browser user agent string to help with spam detection.
After approval of your comment, your profile picture is visible to the public in the context of your comment.
If you upload images to the website, you should avoid uploading images with embedded location data (EXIF GPS) included.
Visitors to the website can download and extract any location data from images on the website.

If you leave a comment on our site, you may opt in to saving your name, email address, and website in cookies. These are for your convenience so that you do not have to fill in your details again when leaving another comment.
These cookies will last for one year.
If you visit our login page, we will set a temporary cookie to determine if your browser accepts cookies. This cookie contains no personal data and is discarded when you close your browser.
When you log in, we will also set up cookies to save your login information and screen display preferences. Login cookies last for two days, and screen option cookies last for one year.
If you select ‚ÄúRemember Me‚Äù, your login will persist for two weeks. If you log out, the login cookies will be removed.
If you edit or publish an article, an additional cookie will be saved in your browser. This cookie includes no personal data and expires after one day.
Articles on this site may include embedded content such as videos, images, or articles.
Embedded content from other websites behaves in the same way as if the visitor had visited the other website.
These websites may collect data about you, use cookies, embed third-party tracking, and monitor your interaction with embedded content.

data.title: 6. Who We Share Your Data With

content.text: If you request a password reset, your IP address will be included in the reset email.

data.title: 7. How Long We Retain Your Data

content.text: If you leave a comment, the comment and its metadata are retained indefinitely so we can recognize and approve follow-up comments automatically.
For users that register on our website, we store the personal information they provide in their user profile.
All users can see, edit, or delete their personal information at any time, except they cannot change their username. Website administrators can also see and edit that information.

data.title: 8. What Rights You Have Over Your Data

content.text: If you have an account on this site or have left comments, you can request to receive an exported file of the personal data we hold about you.
You can also request that we erase any personal data we hold about you, excluding data we are obliged to keep for administrative, legal, or security purposes.
Visitor comments may be checked through an automated spam detection service.
